moves.1. e4 d5: The Center Counter defense and if white is not greedy and developes normally, he should maintain an advantage.
moves.2. exd5 Nf6 3. d4 Bg4 4. f3 Bf5 5. g4: Now the problems for white seem to be starting. Better is Bb4+ and prepare to castle king-side.
moves.5... Bg6 6. c4: A player of this rating should reject any plan that makes his pawn structure look like this.
moves.6... e6 7. Nc3 exd5 8. g5 Nfd7 9. Nxd5 N: Not good. Black can exchange this bishop off and have three developed pieces against one, and have a better pawn structure but still a pawn down.
moves.10... Bd6 11. Bxd6 cxd6 12. h4: There is a lot of undefended room behind white's pieces.
moves.14... Nb4 15. Qa4+ Kf8 16. Ne2: Clearly the losing move brought about by the undended squares deep in the white position.
moves.16... Nc2+ 17. Kd2 Qe3+: Qe3+! Resignable now because of the material loss that can't be avoided.
moves.18. Kd1 Qxf3 19. Rg1 Qd3+ 20. Kc1 Nxa1 2: Nf4? loses on the spot. Nothing but undefended pieces scattered about.
moves.21... Qe3+: This defense held because of poor play by white and can't be considered the best response to e4.
